intro: Ceropegia filifolia, commonly known as the threadleaf ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and distinctive, small, thread-like leaves. The plant produces delicate, tubular flowers that are typically pale green to white in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in hanging baskets.
